metadata.Title: CVE-2018-15173 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - low
metadata.Description:
Nmap through 7.70, when the -sV option is used, allows remote attackers tocause a denial of service (stack consumption and application crash) via acrafted TCP-based service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-15173` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ncat - 7.80+dfsg1-2build1
ndiff - 7.80+dfsg1-2build1
nmap - 7.80+dfsg1-2build1
nmap-common - 7.80+dfsg1-2build1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: nmap package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.80+dfsg1-2build1').
